com.absio.container

Class Keys

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.container.Keys

  • public class Keys
extends Object
    This represents the keys needed to property encrypt a Container or decrypt a SecuredContainer. There is a cipher key (encrypt/decrypt) and a mac key (content validation to avoid tampering).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Keys()
      Create a new set of Keys using CipherTransformation.AES_CTR_NOPADDING, MacAlgorithm.HMACSHA384 and new random keys.
      Keys(CipherTransformation cipherTransformation, byte[] cipherKey, MacAlgorithm macAlgorithm, byte[] macKey)
      Create a keys object using the parameters.

    • Method Summary

      byte[] getCipherKey()
      Get the cipher key.
      CipherTransformation getCipherTransformation()
      Get the cipher transformation used when encrypting and decrypting with the cipher key.
      MacAlgorithm getMacAlgorithm()
      Get the mac algorithm to use when creating or verifying a digest with the mac key.
      byte[] getMacKey()
      Get the mac key to use when creating or verifying a digest.
      UUID getUserId()
      Get the user's id that created the keys.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Keys

        public Keys()
        Create a new set of Keys using CipherTransformation.AES_CTR_NOPADDING, MacAlgorithm.HMACSHA384 and new random keys.

      • Keys

        public Keys(CipherTransformation cipherTransformation,
            byte[] cipherKey,
            MacAlgorithm macAlgorithm,
            byte[] macKey)
        Create a keys object using the parameters.
        Parameters:
        cipherTransformation - the cipher transformation to be used with the cipher key
        cipherKey - the cipher key for encryption/decryption operations
        macAlgorithm - the mac algorithm used with the mac key for data validation
        macKey - the mac key used to create and verify digests - data validation

        public byte[] getCipherKey()
